reviews.text: Had a executive room and was great,you hear a few horns but nothing extreme.foods good.hotel very clean.. I must commend the staff here I got very sick and they helped me through it every way possible they couldn't help me enough.I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Clean and the staff are 5 star

reviews.text: The Silk Path is well located on the outskirts of the Old Quarter. The room was small but clean and cool and had everything we needed. We appreciated being on the top floor (8) at the back of the hotel so street noise was not a problem at all. The breakfast was outstanding - wide ranging and excellent quality, especially the pastries! The hotel is only a short (and cheap) taxi ride from all the sights of Hanoi and close enough for a cyclo driver to drop you back at your hotel after a ride. The staff at the front desk and door were extremely helpful with good English - all of our questions were answered and great suggestions proffered. We were impressed by the thoughtfulness and honesty of the staff one morning when we left our backpack in the breakfast area - they called our room straight away to advise us of our error. All in all, would strongly recommend and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value, clean and close to everything

reviews.text: Well located, very tidy and clean, friendly staff, good breakfast buffet, and nice renovated rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location & value!

reviews.text: I was given a room on the 2nd floor (same as the business center), and at first it felt a little odd that it was an interior room with window facing hall/elevator. However after listening to people talking about their noisy 7th floor room I realized how great of a room I had! Just very quiet!
reviews.title: Can't believe this is only ranked 43rd...it's a real gem

reviews.text: Located on a bustling junction in the Old Quarter, the hotel is an easy walk to all sorts of interesting places and some great local restaurants. Yet it's only a short ride in a cyclo from sights such as the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum.
reviews.title: High quality Hotel in Central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Silk Path for a total of 5 days which included us going up to Sapa on the overnight train and staying one night n Sapa and then returning by train to arrive back at Silk Path at 6am then staying 3 nights then leaving again to go to Halong Bay. When we did both the Sapa and Halong Halong Bay trips the hotel were only too happy to hold our bags s we only needed to take a 30ltr Bagpack for the overnight stays, which made life a lot easier in not having to take our large suitcases with us. We we checked in for the 3 nights they,gave us an upgrade to a Suite which was very nice for no extra charge. As others have mentioned all the staff at the Silk Path go out of there way to be friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble for them. The buffet breakfast has a very good amount of variety and we ate in the restaurant twice and was very impressed with the quality of the food, pricing was also very reasonable for a hotel. The location is great for first time visitors to Hanoi as it is close to the old quarters, the lake and also the train station and also lots of very good restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. would certainly return to the Silk Path when next in Hanoi
reviews.title: Great Location and Staff are 5 Star

reviews.text: Very nice staff, clean and modern rooms. The breakfast was not included (about 14$). It was good and had a lot of different food at the buffet to choose from. The restaurant (bellissimo) was quite ok and the prices were reasonable. The hotel staff organized a taxi to the airport for a fixed (and cheaper) fee. I would recommend this hotel to every traveller who wants to do sight-seeing in Hanoi.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the centre of the old town
Nice hotel, great location
reviews.text: When you see the very narrow entrance you dont think that a nice hotel will be behind those doors. Marble lobby area decorated with huge paintings in bright colors is ver striking. I dont know if its newly built but the hotel definitely looks and feels brand new. I stayed in a single room, not very big but enough for one person. Very comfy, very clean, especially the bathroom is fantastic and very luxurios. Breakfat buffet is virtually endless, a lot of things to eat. But probably the best thing about this hotel is the location; just 8-10 minutesnof walking distance from the center.
